properties.areaDesc: Champaign; Logan; Hardin; Union; Shelby; Wayne; Auglaize; Miami; Mercer; Darke
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 9 at 10:07AM EST by NWS Wilmington OH
properties.description:
Precipitation spreading into the area after 3 PM will likely begin
as snow, and continue a few hours before changing to rain by early
this evening. Some of the snow will be moderate or even heavy in
nature, with the potential for hourly accumulation rates to
approach a half inch or even one inch per hour. A quick 1 to 2
inches of snow is possible, with localized amounts near 3 inches
possible from Celina to Kenton, where the heaviest snow rates have
the highest chance of developing.

Road surfaces will initially be warm enough to limit travel
impacts, but as snow rates increase and darkness approaches, some
slippery travel is likely to develop across the area, as well as
reduced visibility below a mile. Once the precipitation changes to
rain and temperatures rise into the mid 30s, any travel impacts
will quickly improve.

NWSheadline: Period of Accumulating Snow Likely This Afternoon and Evening
